subject: Cooking
title: Eating Rituals: Why Manners Matter to the Brain
description: One-minute skill: Eating Rituals: Why Manners Matter to the Brain.

hook.text: Japanese say 'itadakimasu' before eating. Christians say grace. Even atheists pause. Rituals enhance food.

buildup.text: Research shows that performing a small ritual before eating increases enjoyment of the food that follows.

discovery.text: Rituals force attention and anticipation. They slow the brain down, priming reward circuits before the first bite.

twist.text: Even arbitrary rituals work ‚Äî one study had people knock on tables before eating, and they enjoyed food more.

climax.text: The ritual doesn't need to be religious or cultural. Any deliberate pause before eating enhances pleasure.

punchline.text: Rituals don't bless food. They prepare the brain to enjoy it.

quiz.question: Why do pre-meal rituals enhance food enjoyment?
options: They force attention and prime reward circuits
